posts.title: ğŸ§  Naming the Project: SeatMaster
posts.body: Started as a simple idea in class to help hosts and servers see which tables are open. After a few doodles and joking names, SeatMaster stuck as the official project name.

posts.title: ğŸ—ºï¸ First Floor Plan Sketches
posts.body: Sketched out the first version of the floor map with booths, indoor tables, and a small patio section. These hand-drawn layouts later became the button grid in Code.org App Lab.

posts.title: ğŸ’» First Code.org App Lab Build
posts.body: Built a basic prototype where each table was just a button that changed color. There were no counters, no list mode, and no login screen yetâ€”just a simple visual way to mark tables as open or occupied.

posts.title: ğŸ“Š Adding Seat Counts & Table Types
posts.body: Started tracking how many seats each table had and labeled them as booth, indoor, or patio. This made it easier to imagine how SeatMaster could work in a real restaurant with different sections.

posts.title: ğŸ« First Class Demo
posts.body: Used SeatMaster in front of classmates for the first time. The app helped show how table status could update live, and it sparked the idea to eventually turn this into a more professional-looking tool.
